title: The snail database
about-desc-0: The snail database provides informations, such as taxonomy, size and distribution of all living and extinct species of land, sea and freshwater snails.
about-desc-1.0: A snail is a slow-moving gastropod with a spiral coiled shell and a soft body that can completely retract into the shell.
about-desc-2.0: The snail database is an open-source project brought to life in november 2018 that aims to provide copyright-free open access data about land, freshwater and sea snails.
about-desc-2.1: The data provided includes, if available, dimensions, lifespan and location of the snail, whether it is extinct or living and its classification.
about-title-3: How can I use the database?
about-desc-3: This website provides an interface to the SnailDB API, allowing the visualization of snail informations through the web interface. The APIs can also be used in other websites and are documented at the following page:
notfound-desc: The page at the requested address does not exist or it has been moved
error-desc: It is possible that there is no internet connection or the API server is down
sources-desc: Sources of information for the snail database, alphabetically ordered.
